sentence.Network_en: The wing of the plane broke off in midair and the plane crashed.
sentence.Network_cn: 机翼在空中脱落,致使飞机坠毁.

sentence.Network_en: Hundreds of fireworks burst simultaneously in midair.
sentence.Network_cn: 成百上千朵烟花在半空中同时绽放。

sentence.Network_en: Jonathan Seagull exploded in midair and smashed down into a brick - hard sea.
sentence.Network_cn: 海鸥岳纳珊在空中爆炸,摔落硬如砖头的海中.

entry.def: If something happens in mid-air, it happens in the air, rather than on the ground.

example.ex: The bird stopped and hovered in mid-air.
example.tran: 鸟儿停了下来，在半空中盘旋。

means.word_mean: 1. some point in the air; above ground level;

auth_sentence.content: They stared at her, glasses arrested in midair.
auth_sentence.res_content: They stared at her, glasses arrested in midair.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They stared at her, glasses arrested in midair.

auth_sentence.content: Its bucket hung in midair, steel teeth glinting.
auth_sentence.res_content: Its bucket hung in midair, steel teeth glinting.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Its bucket hung in midair, steel teeth glinting.

auth_sentence.content: Then he snatched it midair and ripped it in half.
auth_sentence.res_content: Then he snatched it midair and ripped it in half.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then he snatched it midair and ripped it in half.

sentences.en: He caught a ball in midair.
